Reviews.Title: “eleni”
Reviews.Author: Giannioti E
Reviews.Content: very best thanks to every personnel who is working to KAYA RAMANDA PLAZA INSTANBUL, because they did every best to make our accomodation (5-8 April) very pleasant, easy and comfortable.The reception was very patient and gave us all the necessarily and useful information we needed.

Reviews.Title: “my best eva hotel in turkey”
Reviews.Author: Shofo
Reviews.Content: Excellent service , clean environment , friendly and very helpful staff , excellent and very tasty food.

Reviews.Title: “Stuck by bad flying weather, not pleased by the Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Msmoliner
Reviews.Content: The Place may be ok for Turkish weddings with 1000 guests, but if you want (or was we did, need to...) spend some time there you become frustrated. Biiiig, filthy, smelly and far away from town. And if you need things like a toothbrush or extra towel, good luck! Next time I get stuck in Istanbul with Turkish Airlines, I pick the hotel myself...can't be worse...

Reviews.Title: “nice!”
Reviews.Author: vasaio012
Reviews.Content: very good hotel, clean, nice, with a usefull shuttle service to the airport. wifi in the lobby (free) and good room service

Reviews.Title: “Kaya Ramada Plaza”
Reviews.Author: EmreGuler
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay next to the TUYAP Exhibition Centre, this is the best choice. The hotel is too far to the Istanbul City centre. The room is big enough, the bathroom is ok. You can start the day with a good breakfeast.

Reviews.Title: “If you're going to the Fair, this is it!”
Reviews.Author: PETERParis
Reviews.Content: Again, in many places, specially Africa and Asia, 5 stars mean Europe's 3 in many ways. The hotel could be cleaner, services are alright, but in no way it's a 5*. HEavy Xray control at the entrance. All floors and all rooms have a carpet. Not the best for a clean hotel. Bathrooms are huge in Deluxe Rooms. Two showers. Views are excellent from any room, even any height. The hotel has 28 floors. Don't even bother clinbing up to the roof restaurant. Nothing really happens although you may feel tempted by the beauties offering a night-life experience. Let's be clear: the ONLY reason to stay here as a tourist is because for some reason, you are attending TÃ¼yap's fair. It's barely a 10minute walk. Unless you rent a car, you're miles from Istanbul. Miles meaning a one hour drive to Taksim (150 TL), a 40 minute drive if not too much traffic to the Airport (70 TL). There's nothing within walking distance from this huge building. NOTHING. You're 10 minutes by cab to this coast place which is pretty and there's life. If you were to stay a week in the Fair, I would suggest ESER hotel in this coast village. At least you can go for a walk. Internet access was good and there's 2 PC?s available, 24h. Poor colour printer. Breakfast wants to ressemble those open-buffets from good Spanish hotels, but the products are all pretty dodgy. Yes there's scrambled eggs but they don't taste like them. Yes, there's orange juice but it tastes like honey. And no: no bacon.

Reviews.Title: “The only good thing is beeing near congress centre if you are coming just for that”
Reviews.Author: unkown2011
Reviews.Content: Only chose this hotel because it is the closest to congress and fair centre. Otherwise would never choose it. Rooms without window are awful. Upon arrival the smell is disgustive. Tv is too old. Taxi arranged to city centre was over charged. Breakfast is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Ramada Kaya Plaza”
Reviews.Author: john&lynda
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated miles from anywhere and not quite sure why people would visit this area of Istanbul. I was sent there on business. First impressions are good and the staff were friendly and efficient. Room was of a good size and clean, but did smell of cigarette smoke. Room had a bath and seperate shower. A good buffet breakfast is included in the price and has a fine selection of products. The jewel in the crown of this hotel is its fitness centre and swimming pool which are both first class and is manned by friendly and helpful staff. Would not want to visit this area again as their are very few places to eat or visit, but if you need to use the hotel it is clean and adequte for most needs.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for sleep”
Reviews.Author: MANCTURK
Reviews.Content: Room was ok,nothing special. Had to pay for internet. The Hotel itself in the middle of nowhere,too far from Istanbul city centre as I had to change 3 public transport to get into the city centre. Staff couldn't speak much of English and not really willing to help. Drinks are expensive for Turkey as you would expect a bit cheaper than UK (Pint of Lager Â£5,50) A company paid for my accommodation so l wont complain anymore but lf l had to pay then l would never stay in this Hotel. Will definetly stay somewhere in the city centre and much cheaper and access to everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “How to ask something more for a business trip?”
Reviews.Author: DiPiers
Reviews.Content: I have been in Istanbul for "Wood Machinery Processing" (Tuyap exhibition) and I staied at Kaya Ramada. 800 mt from the exhibition, with free-bus between the two places. Free wi-fi only in the lobby but it is enought (in the rooms the prices are not so high, but free is better). Swimming pool, fitness center, sauna, etc. Fantastic see from the restaurant at the last floor. The rooms were clean and confortable. For sure I will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms and clean but average experience”
Reviews.Author: AgentAC
Reviews.Content: The hotel i big and located next to the tayap expo center which is very handy. About 1h from the city center and 30 from the airport taking into account there is no traffic. Times could double. Since it was a business trip the location which was next to the expo was key. Other than that nothing special around here. They say there is a shopping center but i could not bother. The rooms were big and clean. Breakfast buffet was very rich. Internet access free from the lobbys wifi, but in the rooms only cable. Reception desk staff was not very helpful. Rates are high but you can get big discounts if a local company has special deal with them. Good hitel if visiting the expo, other than that i would try something else

Reviews.Title: “Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sandi123Mn
Reviews.Content: This is beautiful hotel. Friendly & helpful staff. But, it is nowhere near anything to do. Not even walking distance to restaurants. So although the hotel food is good, you are stuck eating there & paying their prices. Plus it is not easy to get anywhere from there due to terrible traffic & the need to use a taxi. The air conditioning was not adjustable & the room was very hot.

Reviews.Title: “Rip off hotel”
Reviews.Author: mik4647
Reviews.Content: Let's start with a positive - Hotel is clean and the rooms are OK, the bathroom seemed to have just been refurbished, but with poor taste (although good quailty appilances). Now the down side, its miles from anywhare. The food is basic, and never vairied. One evening I asked for fish ( there was no menu), and received a trout, and on checking out I noticed that I had been charger 34 Lira, that's Â£16 or â‚¬19 for a small trout. That is not only ridiculously expensive, but was more that the most expensive item (fillet steak) on the room menu. Which brings me to another issue, in your room you will find the usual hotel directory of services, within this is a section on food, and lets say, for example, you selected smoked salmon, the price listed would be HALF that listed than if you referred to the same item in the seperate room service menu. When I challenged this at the front desk, they could not answer why the outragious variation. It gets worse............ the usual bottles of complimentary water were left on top of the TV (mini bar was locked), on checking the bill, they were attempting to charge for them. Nowhere in the room did it state that these would be charged for, they embarrassingly removed the charge. When I asked to speak to the manager (Mr Turgay Bayar), regarding the above, I was told that he was in a meeting.....I hope it was a meeting about customer service! Do not order a coffee in the lobby, or you will get the shock of you life when you ask to pay. This hotel is nothing short of a rip off, be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: SvetoslavC
Reviews.Content: Nice atmosphere,nice view,good serving,friendly personnel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and Friendly...”
Reviews.Author: HUCEKO
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my customers. Airport is only 20 minutes. This Hotel is located on the top of the mountain (Silence and Fresh air). You can watch wonderful views from your room ( Specially Sea and Lake). You can find big shopping center and wonderful diffirent restaurants in this area. If you bored, you can walk seaside and beach. Seaside is only 5 minutes. Hotel Personals are very friendly. It is wonderful to drink something in Teras Bar (very high).I like Sports Center very much. Pool, Sauna, Fin and Turkish Hammam were very nice. My customers like business meeting rooms. My room was very comfortable. Last one, Prices were not high. Thanks...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, espicially the Roof Restaurant and Bar is wanderfull”
Reviews.Author: markedvin
Reviews.Content: Time to time I stay this hotel. It is about 18 km. to the airport. There is a Tuyap Fear next to the hotel. Espicially the Roof Resataurant and Bar is wanderfull wiev, the food and service is good as well. I like Health Clup, fitness facilities too. if you would like to go to the Buyukcekmece obout 5- 10 minutes by taxi; lots of things to do there even the fish restaurants, bars, historical places, sea wiev etc. I like hotel garden teras also which is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “hotel in nowhere”
Reviews.Author: Rowing_by
Reviews.Content: I came here to attend exhibition in Tyapp. The only benefit of this hotel is that it's close to Tyapp hall. the rest is awful. The hotel needs renovation. Moreover even to get to the nearest inhabited area you need a taxi. The hotel is near a highway. You can not even cross a road. To get to Sultanahmet you need to spend 50 minutes in taxi and pay 80$ or 1.5 hours on public transport. Very poor

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: debs1m
Reviews.Content: We were sent here by British Airways when our flight was cancelled and on the basis of our experience I will never be staying in a Ramada hotel again. This place is in the middle of nowhere, there is nothing to do. The food was atrocious, drinks overpriced. The air con didn't work. Staff were unhelpful. The hotel looks tired and run down and in need of a makeover. I overheard one guest complaining to a staff member that it 'felt like a prison' to which they replied 'yes, a 5 star prison'! Goodness knows how they have managed to get 5 stars. They deserve 2 at best. I would strongly caution anyone who is considering staying here by choice.

Reviews.Title: “Pay five star price for three star hotel then book here.”
Reviews.Author: rizwanh72
Reviews.Content: The room not dusted prior to arrival. The bed had insect infestation which caused rash to me and my wife. The air conditioning was poor and no air extraction in toilet. The cutlery was old and cracked.The spoons in room were dirty. The staff were very arrogant and unhelpful. When staff did not understand english they pretended to understand and then obviously provided the wrong result causing frustration.Full swimming facilities for children were not available despite high demand, The rooms were of good size. Bath towels only two supplied in a triple room. Complimentary internet connection was of a speed what you would expect in 1996 not in 2010 and only then for 7 minutes at a time and then only in the lobby area of the hotel. The name of the free wifi network was the same as the residential area next to the hotel causing suspision. Â£15 for any sort of room connection was criminal when hotels of less than half the price were providing wifi of high quality for free to guests.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Abrar
Reviews.Content: Put here by my airline after flight cancelled. Some aspects of the service were fine - for example, when I asked for tea cups, they were delivered promptly. There are four reasons why I have rated this hotel as being so poor. 1 - at reception while waiting to be served, they decided to serve two (white) people before me. Then one person (who was putting blank keys and cards into a drawer- clearly more important a task then serving me) that his colleague would serve me. His colleague finished off what he was doing and told me that he (the first person) would serve me and walked off. Clearly you are better served here if you are white rather than Asian looking. 2 - they refused to give me a note to say how long I had stayed on the basis that they only gave a receipt when there was something to pay (the airline were paying in my case). I pointed out that they had given something to another person. They denied this until I brought that person over and showed them what they had given her. Even then they gave me what I wanted but clearly reluctantly. 3 - I exchanged some money and was not given the correct amount. Surely their staff should be able to do simple maths or even use a calculator. 4 - they wanted to charge me 4 Euros for some milk for tea!. Throughout all of these experiences, not one apology. Others have said that this hotel is in the middle of nowhere and this is correct. The room was fairly spacious but lacked tea/coffee facilities, which I think is atrocious for a supposedly 5 star hotel. And the air conditioning barely worked. I did not choose this hotel and certainly never would again. In fact, based on my experiences here, I think I'll boycott Ramada.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelingman24
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrible. It is in the middle of no where in istanbul, there is nothing around but a mcdonalds. I went there for a convention but i was greatly dissapointed. The prices are over extream, and i would not call this hotel 5 starts, Maybe 3!! The staff barely spoke english and i sware they tried to rip me off on my bill by adding 2 vodkas i didnt drink. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone, its truely is the worst hotel experience i have ever had!

Reviews.Title: “I won't book again”
Reviews.Author: NottsRich
Reviews.Content: This hotel is next to the Tuyap exhibition and convention centre. What an ideal location to book if you are attending a conference (you would have thought). We booked early (6 months in advance) and secured a good rate. As the conference got closed the hotel booked up. In fact they overbooked to the extent that 2 days before the conference they cancelled all the early booking people had made in favour of the later higher rate bookings, ours included. I would not trust that any booking made with this hotel would be honoured.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Business...so and so for tourism”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been in Kaya for business many times during last couple of years. It's a five star hotel. There is a fitness club, sauna, 2 pools and many other services available for the guests. The personel is friendly even if sometimes, excluding receptionists, they don't understand english even if they claim so. The room is big but I would expect something more because, somehow, it doesn't fit with five star quality I have in my mind. There are three restaurants plus one bar where you can eat burgers or fried potatoes. Two are at the second floor, but one of them is often closed and the other, where morning breakfast (very good) is also served, often offers buffet dinner (the quality of the food is good, not so the choice) . The third one is on the top of the hotel, nice view of the lake, if you choose the right side, and nice food. If you choose this third option be prepared to talk a lot or, if you are alone, take with you a book, the service is not the fastest I have ever seen. The bar is good for a beer while you are playing billiard but not so good for eating. If you really cannot live without a cheeseburger, mcdonalds is 200 meters far. Kaya ramada is in a strange area. the neighborhood is a mix of residential/commercial/industrial area and is also next to a trade fair center. Except mcdonalds, you can find few restaurants in the middle of the buildings beside Kaya. Never tried. If you are looking for a nice place to go, there is the Sinan bridge in Buyukcekmece (4-5 Km). It is on the lake I was talking about before. In that area there are a couple of nice restaurants and also the public turkish bath. I suggest this hotel for Business and meetings. They are well organized about that. For tourism is ok but the main problem is to reach the center. There are 40/50 minutes by car depending on the traffic and whenever you want to go somewhere you need a car.

HotelInfo.Name: Ramada Kaya Plaza
HotelInfo.Address: E-5 Otoyolu Tuyap Yani Beylikduzu, Istanbul 34900, Turkey
